Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CC-AMP1 (C. chinense AMP1; natural AMPs; 3S=S, UCSS1a; XXQ; plants; BBMm; more AMPs?)
Sequence Information.Source: hot peppers, interspecific hybrid ghost pepper,Capsicum chinense Ã— frutescens

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (41.46%) tomarine Turgencin AGRAVY: 0.631; Mol formula:  C150H258N39O40S7; M Wt: 3471.377, and Mol ex coeff.: 5925.Chemical modification:  N-terminal Q is a pyroglutamate. Such a modification may help protect peptides from aminopeptidase degradation. Three S-S bonds: C1-C6, C2-C5, and C3-C4.Activity:  LC50: 50% inhibition concentration: Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (LC50 14.5 uM), K. pneumoniae VK148 (LC50 13.2 uM), A. baumannii 5075 (LC50 4.0 uM), and P. aeruginosa 1423 (LC50 6.9 uM).  Bactericidal: MBC against A. baumannii 5075 (LC50 8.6 uM).MOA:bacteria:E. coli:  CC-AMP1 permeabilized outer membranes of E. coli ATCC 25922 with the fluorescent probe N-phenyl-1-naphthylamine (NPN) uptake of 100% from 10 to 40 uM of CC-AMP1. It also permeabilized the inner membrane of E. coli.Toxicity:  human RBC: negligible hemolysis till 40 uM.Reg. 12/2021; updated 3/2024
Literature Information.Author: Culver KD, Allen JL, Shaw LN, Hicks LM.2021
Literature Information.Title: Too Hot to Handle: Antibacterial Peptides Identified in Ghost Pepper
